messages.subject: Re: Thank You All (WAS:  Need Support)
messages.msgSnippet: ... think of me -- YES, I am one of those who do.  I am working on overcoming this, and it is a daily battle.  Thank you for reminding me that being overly
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "simplemom3" <sja3k@a...>
wrote:
>>>>>To the person who asked if I worried about what other people
think of me -- YES, I am one of those who do. I am working on
overcoming this, and it is a daily battle. Thank you for reminding
me that being overly concerned about what somebody ELSE thinks is
truly a waste of precious time. Time that could be spent enjoying
my children, husband, and life in general.>>>>>

Hi again Sharon.
That was me. :-)
One thing that REALLY helps me is a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt.
"Nobody can make you feel inferior without your permission".
I love that quote so much!
When you go to your family's house, write it on a small scrap of
paper and stick it in your pocket as a reminder.
Good luck!!

~ Joanne ~
Mom to Jacqueline (7), Shawna (10) & Cimion (13)
Adopted into our hearts October 30, 2003
http://anunschoolinglife.blogspot.com/

messages.subject: RE:  Thank You All (WAS:  Need Support)
messages.msgSnippet: Hugs to all you ladies you responded to my plea!  You have given me much to think about and ponder.  I am SO glad to have found this group.  There is much
messages.messageBody:
Hugs to all you ladies you responded to my plea! You have given me
much to think about and ponder. I am SO glad to have found this
group. There is much wisdom here.....you all are deeply appreciated.

To the person who asked if I worried about what other people think of
me -- YES, I am one of those who do. I am working on overcoming this,
and it is a daily battle. Thank you for reminding me that being overly
concerned about what somebody ELSE thinks is truly a waste of precious
time. Time that could be spent enjoying my children, husband, and life
in general.

I will go now to ponder and let my "pudding" simmer....and I will be
sure to savor every moment of the cooking process :-)

Yours,
Sharon
